intro: Ducrosia olivieri, commonly known as the olive ducrosia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring hairy, lance-shaped leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid regions. Ducrosia olivieri is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
